name: On-call Engineer's Guide.txt - What does being on-call really mean
description: This section provides an overview of the on-call responsibilities and processes at Razorpay. It emphasizes that the on-call practices are constantly evolving, and it is the team's duty to improve the documentation and processes continuously. The section includes links to resources that explain incident response, triage, escalation matrix, monitoring and alerting systems, and incident management guidelines.
use_cases: Understanding the on-call responsibilities and processes
Familiarizing with the monitoring and alerting systems
Learning about incident response, triage, and escalation procedures
Comprehending incident management practices, such as severity assessment and root cause analysis

name: On-call Engineer's Guide.txt - An on-call engineer should have a certain level of familiarity about things that ties razorpay services together.
description: This section explains the importance of having well-documented runbooks and a centralized dashboard for on-call engineers at Razorpay. Runbooks provide clear instructions to quickly mitigate issues when alerts are triggered, reducing the mean time to resolution (MTTR). The Central Dashboard serves as a single source of truth for monitoring critical metrics, payments, success rates, and overall system health. It helps engineers quickly identify and respond to potential issues.
use_cases: Quickly mitigating issues when alerts are triggered
Monitoring critical metrics, payments, and success rates
